file_content.text: I'll stay at this post until I'm relieved, sir.
I heard the explosions when you set off the charges. Outstanding, sir.
Detonate the explosives at all the k'lor'slug egg chambers, sir. Good luck.
Excuse me, my lord. Sergeant Cormun, Fifth Infantry company, Korriban regiment. Can I--can I talk to you?
Excuse me, acolyte. Sergeant Cormun, Fifth Infantry company, Korriban regiment. Can I--can I talk to you?
Speak freely, Sergeant.
Permission granted.
Thank you.
Make it quick, Sergeant.
Hurry up.
Of course.
Is this necessary?
Understood, sir--but I require assistance from someone who can do things I can't.
I could use the help of someone with as much experience as you have.
You're one of the slaves Harkun brought in on the last transport, right? Here to prove yourself to the bloodthirsty overseers?
What business is that of yours?
That's my affair.
Prove myself or die, apparently.
Something like that.
Yes, that's me all right.
Correct.
The smell must have given you away.
He can tell you're scum.
We both need to prove ourselves.
I need to do the same.
Can we stop talking to this Imperial?
We're wasting time.
You're the acolyte Overseer Tremel had brought in special, right? Heading down in the tomb to show what you're made of?
Mind your business, soldier.
That's my affair.
And to find myself a Sith warblade, apparently.
Among other things.
Yes. That's correct.
True.
It looks like you're famous already.
Word travels fast.
Well here's your chance to not only show off for the overseers but start building ties to the Imperial military, as well.
Hey, I'm special too!
We both are.
This is a waste of our time.
Enough nonsense.
Apologies if I offended. I thought you might appreciate the chance to not only show off for the overseers but build some ties with the Imperial military as well.
I'm here commanding a hard target mission to exterminate k'lor'slugs in this tomb. They're... horrific things. Mouths bigger than your head.
I've lost three squads of good men fighting them. They come in packs--they just... they'll swallow a man whole.
If you're trying to talk me out of this, it won't work.
I have to go in there.
Understood. I was hoping you could assist my operation while you're in there.
Your men obviously need better training, Sergeant.
"Good" men aren't enough.
Those men were battle-hardened. The enemy just has more numbers.
Then I suggest you try a new strategy.
Frontal assault not working?
Look, we--I've identified the enemy's weak spot, but it's not easy to get at.
So what?
Yes, my lord--but I'm running out of men and we're no closer to eliminating the enemy.
Yes, sir--but the mission is in danger of failing. Sending more men isn't the answer.
The damn k'lor'slugs breed so fast there's no way to wipe them out conventionally. So we started targeting their egg chambers. They went insane.
We managed to get explosives to all of the egg chambers, but the k'lor'slugs were all over us before we could detonate them.
Are you sure this plan of yours will actually work?
Your tactics may be flawed.
I don't know. I have to hope so. Without breeding chambers, the k'lor'slugs lose the numbers. Then we can wipe them out.
I'll finish the job.
Thank you. I didn't know if I should ask, but--well, you're Sith. You have abilities no amount of firepower can match.
Why should I care?
I'm hoping you can help, my lord. Someone with your power can finish what we started.
I know, but we can't do it without you. You have a tactical advantage my soldiers don't: the Force. That makes you worth a dozen normal men.
My superior, Captain Juvarek, is stationed on the other side of this tomb. He's authorized hazard pay to anyone who destroys those egg chambers.
If you work your way through the tomb, set off the explosives and thin the k'lor'slug numbers, Captain Juvarek will be extremely grateful.
I hunger for a good slaughter.
Sounds like fun.
Just make sure it's you doing the slaughtering... sir.
Such a trivial task for a master of the dark arts.
That won't be hard at all.
Don't underestimate those k'lor'slugs, sir. They're... they're smarter than they look.
Very well.
Thank you... sir. Good luck in there.
Sounds dull. [Refuse quest]
Understood. Thanks for hearing me out.
Keep away from this tomb, sir. People are dying in there.
Careful. Sith don't appreciate visitors in their sacred tombs.
